text: today's breakfast recipe is a be good to
yourself and your family recipe it's a
cherry and hazelnuts co scones are
actually really easy to make they might
seem a little intimidating because of
the name but they're really not and you
should make them at home because there's
so much better than the kind that you
buy at the store start off by chopping
your nuts these are toasted hazelnuts
without the skin the other thing about
hazelnuts I want you to be aware of is
that they get rancid very quickly so
make sure you store them in your
refrigerator I have 3/4 of a cup of
heavy cream to that add an egg I know
it's an indulgence but it adds so much
delicate richness whisk your egg into
your heavy cream I have 2 cups of
all-purpose flour to that add a quarter
cup of sugar stir your sugar into the
flour add 2 teaspoons of baking powder
1/2 a teaspoon of salt if you're using
coarse salt go ahead and use a teaspoon
and 1/2 of a teaspoon of ground cinnamon
you're not a huge fan of ground cinnamon
you can leave it out I have six
tablespoons of cold unsalted butter cut
into little pizzas work the butter into
the flour mixture until it resembles
coarse meal with some of the pieces of
butter remaining the size of peas scones
like biscuits like pie crusts need to
have the pieces of butter left kind of
big in there in order to steam up in the
oven and cause the layers and the
flakiness add your chopped hazelnuts 2/3
of a cup of dried sour cherries one of
my favorite dried fruits so super delish
but if you can't find them go ahead and
use dried cranberries mix that in
that cream and egg mixture add that and
then just stir it in with a fork you
want to make sure that all the dry
ingredients are fully incorporated but
don't over mix it this like biscuits and
all of those tender flaky things
shouldn't be over mixed so if there's a
tiny bit of flour left in the bottom of
the bowl I'd rather have that and you
mix it in very much at the end when you
turn it onto the surface then over mix
your dough at this point I feel like
most of my flour has been incorporated
when that happens turn it onto a board
clean work surface doesn't have to be a
part just a clean work surface and then
just knead it once or twice to fully
incorporate the flour and to make it
into a nice 6-inch round very cinnamony
should be about an inch thick and then
cut it into six wedges I like to use a
bench scraper if you have one it's great
for cutting up dough's if you don't you
can use a knife transfer your cut scones
to a parchment lined baking sheet now
you can just put these in the oven like
this but if you want to add a special
touch to make it look really
professional you can sprinkle the top
with a little bit of sugar to do that
you want to just brush with a little bit
of heavy cream and then some sanding
sugar I like to use fine sanding sugar
plain sugar is also fine if you can't
get sanding sugar have your oven
preheating to 400 degrees and cook these
until they're golden brown and cooked
through 16 to 18 minutes
allow your scones to cool on a wire :
rack and then dig in give this recipe a
try let me know what you think I think
you're gonna say I can't believe how
much better than store
what they are thank you so much Sarah
for this fantastic scone recipe
you
hi guys thanks for watching this video
be sure to click here if you want to
subscribe and click over here if you
want to continue watching more great
